text: <@U7SL518D6> i agree, happy to help as we've dug pretty deep in the new editor with our recent re-design

Question about Design Manager v2 - the old boilerplate for sites used to have {% include "HubSpot/styles/patches/recommended.css" %} 

Include is no longer allowed - is everyone just taking the css that is in that file and adding it inline now or? <@U25C65C3S> if you have any input on what your team did regarding that I'd love to know.
<@U7SL518D6> we added that additional css into the head of our css global css file
and then included the css at the template level
k that's what I was figuring I was going to do with it.

Bug Report: I copied some v1 modules to a portal that I then made v2 - it caused the original portal(HS site) suddenly start displaying all the stylesheets combined "<http://www.oshkoshairport.com/hs-fs/hub/1641167/hub_generated/template_assets/1515464694085/combined-css-84bab56f1b4b7e3f4f2a285fbbb0a3ba.css>"

It's not screwing up the site, but it's making debugging kinda hellish. I'm looking for some CSS and can't actually find it in the files that it's supposed to be in yet it's in the combined css file.

Edit - found the css I was looking for - still weird that it's doing that combining thing on a design manager v1 site though
